open_questions.title: Spring and what are its benefits
open_questions.description: What is Spring and what are its benefits?
open_questions.prompt: You are evaluating a junior-level candidate. Answer the question: "What is Spring and what are its benefits?" Requirements: - Define the concept in your own words - Give a small example - Mention a common pitfall or best practice Style: - Clear, structured, concise. - Use code snippets only if they add clarity. - Avoid vague statements.
open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: Spring is a framework that provides a lot of features and functionality for building enterprise-level applications. It provides a wide range of features that make it easier to develop and deploy Spring-based applications.
keyPoints: Define the concept in your own words
Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice

open_questions.title: The difference between Spring and Spring
open_questions.description: What is the difference between Spring and Spring Boot?
open_questions.prompt: You are evaluating a junior-level candidate. Answer the question: "What is the difference between Spring and Spring Boot?" Requirements: - Define the concept in your own words - Give a small example - Mention a common pitfall or best practice Style: - Clear, structured, concise. - Use code snippets only if they add clarity. - Avoid vague statements.
open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: Spring is a framework that provides a lot of features and functionality for building enterprise-level applications. Spring Boot is built on top of the Spring framework and provides a simpler and faster way to build Spring-based applications.
keyPoints: Define the concept in your own words
Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice

open_questions.title: The advantages of using Spring Boot
open_questions.description: What are the advantages of using Spring Boot for developing Java web applications?
open_questions.prompt: You are evaluating a junior-level candidate. Answer the question: "What are the advantages of using Spring Boot for developing Java web applications?" Requirements: - Define the concept in your own words - Give a small example - Mention a common pitfall or best practice Style: - Clear, structured, concise. - Use code snippets only if they add clarity. - Avoid vague statements.
open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: Spring Boot simplifies and accelerates the development of Java web applications by providing defaults and auto-configuration, reducing boilerplate code, and offering a wide range of pre-built components for various tasks, including embedded web servers and database access.
keyPoints: Define the concept in your own words
Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice

referenceAnswers.text: Inversion of control (IoC) is a design pattern in which the control of object creation and dependency injection is moved from the application code to a framework like Spring.

open_questions.title: The Model-View-Controller (MVC) pattern, and how
open_questions.description: What is the Model-View-Controller (MVC) pattern, and how does Spring MVC implement it?
open_questions.prompt: You are evaluating a junior-level candidate. Answer the question: "What is the Model-View-Controller (MVC) pattern, and how does Spring MVC implement it?" Requirements: - Define the concept in your own words - Give a small example - Mention a common pitfall or best practice Style: - Clear, structured, concise. - Use code snippets only if they add clarity. - Avoid vague statements.
open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: MVC is a design pattern that separates an application into three interconnected components: Model (business logic/data), View (presentation), and Controller (handles requests). Spring MVC provides a framework for building web applications following this pattern.
keyPoints: Define the concept in your own words
Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice

open_questions.title: The purpose of the @Autowired annotation
open_questions.description: What is the purpose of the @Autowired annotation in Spring?
open_questions.prompt: You are evaluating a junior-level candidate. Answer the question: "What is the purpose of the @Autowired annotation in Spring?" Requirements: - Define the concept in your own words - Give a small example - Mention a common pitfall or best practice Style: - Clear, structured, concise. - Use code snippets only if they add clarity. - Avoid vague statements.
open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: The @Autowired annotation in Spring is used for automatic dependency injection. It allows Spring to automatically inject a dependency (such as another bean or a service) into a Spring-managed component, reducing the need for manual wiring.

Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice
